alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 10:23AM CDT until April 28 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...Forecast flooding remains in moderate stage, but is above flood of record, and increased in duration for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River below Warren affecting Marshall County. .The Snake River below Warren has crossed above Flood of Record. The river is expected to slowly continue to rise before cresting sometime this evening or overnight around 72.5 feet. River falls are expected to begin early this week. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. This is the flood of record. * WHERE...Snake River below Warren. * WHEN...Until early Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 71.0 feet, MODERATE FLOOD STAGE. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 72.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM CDT Sunday was 72.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 72.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 67.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
